data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
One should always face forward. Left is always the same way. Forward is always the same way. Right is always the same way. Take backward is the opposite of forward. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you take 4 steps you take 4 steps. If you turn around you take 4 steps. If you turn right then you turn right. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turning around and taking 4 steps are the same process. You need 4 steps to take 4 steps back to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The first 7 steps in this sequence are the same as the first 7 steps taken on the way out. The last 5 steps take you to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around turns around takes 9 steps. There are 2 directions in this scenario. Turn around turns around takes 11 steps. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Turn around and then take 7 steps to go reverse. Take 7 steps to turn right. Turn left. Take 7 steps to turn right. Turn around and then turn around. Take seven steps to go back the other way. Yes. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you know the first step you can perform the following steps: Take 8 steps; Take 9 steps; Turn right; Take 8 steps; Take 9 steps; Turn left. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Turn around. Take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 6 steps then turn around and take 8 steps. So the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The guide says you should take one step left before the next step. One step is equal to one step forward. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you take 9 steps after turning around, you will take 2 steps. If you take 7 steps after turning around, you will take 7 steps. Since 3 is the fourth step of the instructions, we return to the starting point by 3 steps. Thus, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you take 1 step backward, that always happens backward. Just like you don’ t face forward, you don’ t take steps forward. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You always face forward. If you take 6 steps backwards, you return to square 1. You can also face forward and take 6 steps left. So, the answer is No.

If you take 5 steps left, you are back at the beginning point. If you take 9 steps left, you are back at the starting point. So, the answer is No.

Taking 3 steps forward and take 4 steps left is the same as taking 3 steps forward and taking 4 steps left. Thus, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions with care, you are bound to end up facing forward always. So, the answer is Yes.

Turn right and turn around. Turn around and take 4 steps. Take 8 steps. So, the answer is No.

Take 6 steps to take 6 steps back. 10 steps to make the complete turn around. Take 3 steps for the complete turn around. Take 6 steps to turn around. Take 10 steps to turn around.

You do not return to the starting point. All turns are from the previous direction and all the steps are the same. So, the answer is No.

If you turn right, you go 1 step back. If you take 7 steps, you go 7 steps forward. Turn right, and take 1 step forward. So, the answer is Yes.

Turning left is one of the steps in the first step. If you take 6 steps you have taken 6 additional steps. Thus, the answer is Yes.

Take 2 steps. Turn around and take 2 steps. It is the second of the second set of instructions and then the first step. So, the answer is No.

Turning around takes multiple movements. The time spent turning around is several minutes. So, the answer is Yes.

If you always face forward, you will always go forward. You cannot take 7 steps left, take 2 steps right, or leave. Taking 5 steps backward makes you go in reverse. Taking 7 steps forward makes you go in the opposite direction of what you were headed in. Thus, the answer is No.

Take all of your steps backwards, every time you move out of your line of vision. Every time you move out of your line of vision, you make a leap of faith. The starting point is your left stance. So, the answer is No.

Turn around and take 4 steps to find where you came into. So, the answer is yes.

If you always face forward, you do not need to take left and right. They are opposites. So, the answer is no.

Take 3 steps backward the first time you face forward. Take 2 steps backward the second time you face forward. So, the answer is No.

To return to the starting point, you must take 1 step. So, the answer is no.

If the instructions repeat, you will return to the starting point. You can only turn around after the original starting point is back. So, the answer is yes.

It takes 10 steps right to make your way back to the starting point. If you want reverse, you can take 3 steps left once you end in the starting point. One cannot get back to the starting point from the starting point. So, the answer is No.

Every time we turn back inward, we are always facing forward. When someone directs you to always face forward, it prevents you from turning backward. When someone takes 10 steps backward, you return to where you started. They do NOT make you turn backward as you do when they' re turning around. Thus, the answer is no.

If you are facing a straight line, you can also take 5 steps left and 8 steps right. The starting point is either right or left and the forward is either left or right. If you take 5 steps right, you'll always be facing forward so you cannot return to the negative direction. So, the answer is no.
